<trait label="Rare" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=137" />
<trait label="Arcane" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=11" />
<trait label="Cantrip" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=22" />
<trait label="Cold" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=27" />
<trait label="Conjuration" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=33" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Treasure Vault](/Sources.aspx?ID=191) pg. 185 <sup>1.1</sup></row>

<row gap="medium">

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** 30 feet

**Target** 1 object
</row>

<row gap="medium">

</row>

</column>

---

Your _[gelid shard](/Equipment.aspx?ID=2369)_ drinks down nearby heat in a futile attempt to sate itself and achieve a level of frigid cold unheard of on the [Material Plane](/Planes.aspx?ID=1). This allows you to cool a drink, make a hot pot safe to handle, or other, similar minor effects. Once cooled, the object's temperature is subject to its environment as usual. You can also solidify ambient moisture into a solid object; this temporary object is of negligible Bulk, made of non-magical ice. The object looks crude and artificial and is extremely fragile—it can't be used as a tool, weapon, or spell component. Once created, it melts as normal for ice for the ambient conditions.

---
**Heightened (3rd)** You can create simple objects of ice with up to 1 Bulk and of a level not exceeding 1. Such objects must be rigid. You can only have one such object created at a time; if you create another, the previous object melts instantly.

**Heightened (5th)** Items you create can be up to 4 Bulk and 4th level.

**Heightened (7th)** Items you create can be up to 8 Bulk and 8th level.

**Heightened (9th)** Items you create can be up to 20 Bulk and 12th level.
_source.name: Frost's Touch

---

You raise a magical updraft to arrest a fall. The target's fall slows to 60 feet per round, and the portion of the fall during the spell's duration doesn't count when calculating [falling damage](/Rules.aspx?ID=402). If the target reaches the ground while the spell is in effect, it takes no damage from the fall. The spell ends as soon as the target lands.

<title level="1" right="Cantrip 1" pfs="Standard">
[Glass Shield](/Spells.aspx?ID=1333)
<actions string="Single Action" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Cantrip" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=22" />
<trait label="Concentrate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=32" />
<trait label="Earth" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=55" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Rage of Elements](/Sources.aspx?ID=205) pg. 94</row>

**Traditions**
[Arcane](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1), [Primal](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=4)

<row gap="medium">

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Defense**
[basic](/Rules.aspx?ID=329) Reflex

**Duration** until the start of your next turn
</row>

</column>

---

You summon a layer of clear glass to keep you from harm. This cantrip functions as the [_shield_](/Spells.aspx?ID=280) spell, except it has Hardness 2 and 4 Hit Points. If this shield breaks, provided the breaker is within 5 feet, they must succeed at a basic Reflex save or take 1d4 piercing damage from the glass shards.

---
**Heightened (3rd)** The shield has Hardness 4 and 8 Hit Points, and the damage increases to 1d4 + your spellcasting attribute modifier.

**Heightened (5th)** The shield has Hardness 7 and 16 Hit Points, and the damage increases to 2d4 + your spellcasting attribute modifier.

**Heightened (7th)** The shield has Hardness 10 and 24 Hit Points, and the damage increases to 3d4 + your spellcasting attribute modifier.

**Heightened (9th)** The shield has Hardness 12 and 32 Hit Points, and the damage increases to 4d4 + your spellcasting attribute modifier.
_source.name: Glass Shield

---

You glimpse a loose scale, a seam in a foe's armor, or a similar weakness, aiding your allies in landing a precise hit. The first ally that hits the target with a successful Strike deals additional precision damage equal to 1 + this spell's level, and then the spell ends.

---

<title level="1" right="Spell 1" pfs="Limited">
[Glowing Trail](/Spells.aspx?ID=1428)
<actions string="Two Actions" />
</title>

<spoilers>May contain spoilers from Sky King's Tomb</spoilers>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Transmutation" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=157" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Pathfinder #194: Cult of the Cave Worm](/Sources.aspx?ID=209) pg. 79</row>

**Traditions**
[Arcane](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1), [Divine](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=2), [Occult](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=3), [Primal](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=4)

<row gap="medium">

**Cast** [somatic](/Rules.aspx?ID=283), [verbal](/Rules.aspx?ID=284)

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">

</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** 1 hour
</row>

</column>

---

Your movements leave a vague glowing path behind you, like a misty echo of your presence. While your form is not discernible, your size is. This path hangs in space and is not anchored to any surface, so it tracks your movement through the air. The path fades after 10 minutes. You can Dismiss this spell at any time, but the path fades normally.

 The path can be visible or invisible. While visible, it appears as a faintly glowing mist in a color of your choosing but sheds no light beyond its area. While invisible, you can still detect the path, but it gives off no light.

---
**Heightened (3rd)** The glowing trail fades after 1 day.

**Heightened (5th)** The glowing trail fades after 1 week.

**Heightened (7th)** The glowing trail fades after 1 month.

**Heightened (9th)** The glowing trail fades after 1 year.
_source.name: Glowing Trail

**Source** [Player Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=216) pg. 333 **Traditions** [Arcane](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1), [Primal](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=4) **Range** 30 feet **Area** 4 contiguous 5-foot squares or **Target** 1 object of 1 Bulk or less **Duration** 1 minute --- You conjure grease, choosing an area or target.
  • **Area** All solid ground in the area is covered with grease. Each creature standing on the greasy surface must succeed at a Reflex save or an [Acrobatics](/Skills.aspx?ID=1) check against your spell DC or fall [prone](/Conditions.aspx?ID=31). Creatures using an action to move onto the greasy surface during the spell's duration must attempt either a Reflex save or an Acrobatics check to [Balance](/Actions.aspx?ID=28). A creature that Steps or [Crawls](/Actions.aspx?ID=76) doesn't have to attempt a check or save.
  • **Target** If you Cast the Spell on an unattended object, anyone trying to pick up the object must succeed at an Acrobatics check or Reflex save against your spell DC to do so. If you target an attended object, the creature that has the object must attempt an Acrobatics check or Reflex save. On a failure, the holder or wielder takes a –2 circumstance penalty to all checks that involve using the object; on a critical failure, the holder or wielder releases the item. The object lands in an adjacent square of the GM's choice. If you Cast this Spell on a worn object, the wearer gains a +2 circumstance bonus to Fortitude saves against attempts to grapple them.

 If the target would become [confused](/Conditions.aspx?ID=5), they reduce the duration of the confused condition by 1 round, to a minimum of 1 round. If the target would become [frightened](/Conditions.aspx?ID=19) or [stupefied](/Conditions.aspx?ID=37), they reduce the value of the frightened or stupefied condition by 1, to a minimum of 1. Once any of these conditions occur, the spell ends.

---
**Heightened (+3)** The status bonus increases by 1.

One small space becomes inhospitable to [undead](/Traits.aspx?ID=160) as you fill it with life-infused benevolent magic. Each undead creature in the area takes 1d6 positive damage and 1d4 good damage when you Cast the Spell, with a [basic](/Rules.aspx?ID=329) Fortitude save. After that, undead creatures have weakness 1 to [positive](/Traits.aspx?ID=128) damage and your [necromancy](/Traits.aspx?ID=117) spells while in the area.

 This spell also automatically attempts to [counteract](/Rules.aspx?ID=371) any attempt to raise undead in the area (if either the undead would appear in the area or the effect's caster or creator is in it). 

If you Cast this Spell again, any previous _hallowed ground_ you had cast ends.

---
**Heightened (+2)** The positive damage increases by 1d6, good damage increases by 1d4, and weakness increases by 1.

<title level="1" right="Cantrip 1" pfs="Standard">
[Haunting Hymn](/Spells.aspx?ID=924)
<actions string="Two Actions" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Auditory" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=16" />
<trait label="Cantrip" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=22" />
<trait label="Evocation" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=65" />
<trait label="Sonic" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=147" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Secrets of Magic](/Sources.aspx?ID=96) pg. 109 <sup>1.1</sup></row>

**Traditions**
[Divine](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=2), [Occult](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=3)

<row gap="medium">

**Cast** [somatic](/Rules.aspx?ID=283), [verbal](/Rules.aspx?ID=284)

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Area** 15-foot cone

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Saving Throw** 
Fortitude

</row>

</column>

---

You echo a jarring hymn that only creatures in the area can hear. The hymn deals 1d8 sonic damage, with a [basic](/Rules.aspx?ID=329) Fortitude save. If a target critically fails the save, it's also [deafened](/Conditions.aspx?ID=8) for 1 minute.

---
**Heightened (+2)** The damage increases by 1d8.
_source.name: Haunting Hymn

**Source** [Player Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=216) pg. 335 **Traditions** [Divine](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=2), [Primal](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=4) **Range** varies **Target** 1 willing living creature or 1 undead creature --- You channel vital energy to heal the living or damage the [undead](/Traits.aspx?ID=160). If the target is a willing living creature, you restore 1d8 Hit Points. If the target is undead, you deal that amount of vitality damage to it, and it gets a basic Fortitude save. The number of actions you spend when Casting this Spell determines its targets, range, area, and other parameters. The spell has a range of touch.
([concentrate](/Traits.aspx?ID=32)) The spell has a range of 30 feet. If you're healing a living creature, increase the Hit Points restored by 8.
([concentrate](/Traits.aspx?ID=32)) You disperse vital energy in a 30-foot emanation. This targets all living and undead creatures in the burst. --- **Heightened (+1)** The amount of healing or damage increases by 1d8, and the extra healing for the 2-action version increases by 8.
_source.name: Heal

<title level="1" right="Focus 1" pfs="Standard">
[Healer's Blessing](/Spells.aspx?ID=1808)
<actions string="Single Action" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Cleric" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=26" />
<trait label="Concentrate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=32" />
<trait label="Focus" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=511" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Player Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=216) pg. 375</row>

**Domain**
[Healing](/Domains.aspx?ID=78)

<row gap="medium">

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** 30 feet

**Target** 1 willing living creature
</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** 1 minute
</row>

</column>

---

Your words bless a creature with an enhanced connection to vital energy. When the target regains Hit Points from a [healing](/Traits.aspx?ID=89) [vitality](/Traits.aspx?ID=509) spell, it regains 2 additional Hit Points.

 The target regains additional Hit Points from _healer's blessing_ only the first time it regains HP from a given healing spell, so a spell that heals the creature repeatedly over a duration would restore additional Hit Points only once, when they are first healed.

---
**Heightened (+1)** The additional healing increases by 2 HP.
_source.name: Healer's Blessing

<title level="1" right="Cantrip 1" pfs="Standard">
[Healing Plaster](/Spells.aspx?ID=925)
<actions string="Single Action" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Cantrip" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=22" />
<trait label="Earth" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=55" />
<trait label="Transmutation" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=157" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Secrets of Magic](/Sources.aspx?ID=96) pg. 109 <sup>1.1</sup></row>

**Tradition**
[Primal](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=4)

<row gap="medium">

**Cast** [somatic](/Rules.aspx?ID=283)

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** 5 feet

**Target** a handful of dirt or mud
</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** 10 minutes
</row>

</column>

---

You purify some dirt or mud into a pliable, claylike plaster that can aid in clotting and healing. This restorative substance can be used in lieu of [healer's tools](/Equipment.aspx?ID=25) for [Medicine](/Skills.aspx?ID=9) checks to [Administer First Aid](/Actions.aspx?ID=54) or [Treat Wounds](/Actions.aspx?ID=57). If the plaster isn't used within the spell's duration, or if you Cast the Spell again before using the plaster, it reverts to being normal non-magical earth.

---
**Heightened (3rd)** The plaster grants anyone using it to Administer First Aid or Treat Wounds a +1 item bonus to the Medicine check.
_source.name: Healing Plaster

<title level="1" right="Spell 1" pfs="Standard">
[Helpful Steps](/Spells.aspx?ID=1286)
<actions string="Two Actions" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Conjuration" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=33" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Firebrands](/Sources.aspx?ID=196) pg. 89</row>

**Traditions**
[Arcane](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1), [Divine](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=2), [Occult](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=3), [Primal](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=4)

<row gap="medium">

**Cast** [somatic](/Rules.aspx?ID=283), [verbal](/Rules.aspx?ID=284)

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** 60 feet

</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** 10 minutes
</row>

</column>

---

You call forth a ladder or staircase to help you reach greater heights. The ladder or staircase appears in a space you designate and either stands freely or connects to a nearby wall if possible. You decide the height of the ladder or staircase when casting the spell, up to a maximum height of 40 feet. The ladder or staircase is locked in place and magically supported, allowing you to ascend even if it's in an open area. The conjured ladder is simple in design and made of wood. The staircase is a spiral staircase made of wood. While both are supported and have no risk of falling, they can be damaged and destroyed as normal. The staircase is typically easier to ascend, though it's less discreet than a ladder and could possibly draw more attention. You can Dismiss the spell.

---
**Heightened (+1)** The maximum height increases by 40 feet.
_source.name: Helpful Steps

**Source** [Secrets of Magic](/Sources.aspx?ID=96) pg. 110 1.1 **Traditions** [Arcane](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1), [Primal](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=4) **Range** varies **Target** 1 creature --- You gather magical energy into your palm, forming a concentrated ball of electricity that crackles and rumbles like impossibly distant thunder. Make a ranged spell attack roll against your target's AC. On a success, you deal 3d6 electricity damage. On a critical success, the target takes double damage and is [dazzled](/Conditions.aspx?ID=7) for 1 round. The number of actions you spend when Casting this Spell determines the range and other parameters. **(somatic, verbal)** This spell has a range of 30 feet.
**(material, somatic, verbal)** This spell has a range of 60 feet and deals half damage on a failure (but not a critical failure) as the electricity lashes out and jolts the target.
**Two Rounds** If you spend 3 actions Casting the Spell, you can avoid finishing the spell and spend another 3 actions on your next turn to empower the spell even further. If you do, after attacking the target, whether you hit or miss, the ball of lightning explodes, dealing 2d6 electricity damage to all other creatures in a 10-foot emanation around the target ([basic](/Rules.aspx?ID=329) Reflex save). Additionally, you spark with electricity for 1 minute, dealing 1 electricity damage to creatures that [Grab](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=18) you or that hit you with an [unarmed](/Traits.aspx?ID=199) Strike or a non-[reach](/Traits.aspx?ID=192) melee weapon. --- **Heightened (+1)** The initial damage on a hit, as well as the burst damage for two-round casting time, each increase by 2d6, and the damage creatures take if they Grapple or hit you while you're in your sparking state increases by 1.
_source.name: Horizon Thunder Sphere

<title level="1" right="Focus 1" pfs="Standard">
[Hymn of Healing](/Spells.aspx?ID=1768)
<actions string="Two Actions" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Bard" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=19" />
<trait label="Composition" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=31" />
<trait label="Concentrate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=32" />
<trait label="Focus" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=511" />
<trait label="Healing" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=89" />
<trait label="Vitality" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=509" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Player Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=216) pg. 370</row>

<row gap="medium">

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** 30 feet

**Target** you or 1 ally
</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** sustained up to 4 rounds
</row>

</column>

---

Your glorious singing mends wounds and provides a temporary respite from harm. The target gains [fast healing](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=15) 2. When you Cast the Spell and the first time each round you Sustain the Spell, the target gains 2 temporary Hit Points, which last for 1 round.

---
**Heightened ()** The fast healing and temporary Hit Points each increase by 2
_source.name: Hymn of Healing

**Source** [Gods & Magic](/Sources.aspx?ID=17) pg. 113 2.0 **Domain** [Delirium](/Domains.aspx?ID=43) **Cast** [somatic](/Rules.aspx?ID=283), [verbal](/Rules.aspx?ID=284) **Range** 30 feet **Target** 1 creature **Saving Throw** Will **Duration** varies --- You sharpen a creature’s senses, though more distant objects become hazy, indistinct, or muted to it. The target gains a +1 status bonus to Perception checks attempted with any of its precise senses. Furthermore, any imprecise senses the target has are sharpened to precise senses (though they do not receive the status bonus). However, the target cannot perceive anything beyond a range of 20 feet with any of its senses. The duration is determined by the target’s Will save. You can allow allies to choose the outcome instead of rolling a saving throw. **Critical Success** The target is unaffected.
**Success** The target is affected for 1 round.
**Failure** The target is affected for 1 minute.
**Critical Failure** As failure, but the target cannot perceive anything beyond a range of 10 feet. --- **Heightened (3rd)** You can target up to 2 creatures. **Heightened (6th)** You can target up to 4 creatures.

It must attempt a Will save. **Critical Success** The target is unaffected and realized you attempted to influence its reaction with magic.
**Success** The target takes a –1 status penalty to its defenses against the triggering effect. This penalty is –2 if the target is being encouraged to advance its own ambitions. The target doesn't realize you Cast the Spell on it.
**Failure** As success, but the status penalty is –4 if the target is being encouraged to advance its own ambitions.
**Critical Failure** As success, but the creature automatically follows a suggestion that advances its own ambitions.

You light all non-magical light sources in the area that use fire to provide their light—such as candles, lamps, and sconces. You can choose to make the emanation smaller than its maximum, to any distance of your choice. ---

<title level="1" right="Spell 1" pfs="Standard">
[Illusory Disguise](/Spells.aspx?ID=159)
<actions string="Two Actions" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Illusion" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=92" />
<trait label="Visual" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=163" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 345 <sup>4.0</sup></row>

**Traditions**
[Arcane](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1), [Occult](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=3)

**Bloodlines**
[Hag](/Bloodlines.aspx?ID=8), [Genie](/Bloodlines.aspx?ID=11)

**Deities**
[Hastur](/Deities.aspx?ID=162), [Likha](/Deities.aspx?ID=192), [Likha](/Deities.aspx?ID=192), [Mahathallah](/Deities.aspx?ID=170), [Mahathallah](/Deities.aspx?ID=170), [Nivi Rhombodazzle](/Deities.aspx?ID=44), [Norgorber](/Deities.aspx?ID=13), [Sivanah](/Deities.aspx?ID=46), [The Lantern King](/Deities.aspx?ID=95)

<row gap="medium">

**Cast** [somatic](/Rules.aspx?ID=283), [verbal](/Rules.aspx?ID=284)

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">

</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** 1 hour
</row>

</column>

---

You create an illusion that causes you to appear as another creature of the same body shape, and with roughly similar height (within 6 inches) and weight (within 50 pounds), as yourself. The disguise is typically good enough to hide your identity, but not to impersonate a specific individual. The spell doesn't change your voice, scent, or mannerisms. You can change the appearance of your clothing and worn items, such as making your armor look like a dress. Held items are unaffected, and any worn item you remove returns to its true appearance.

 Casting _illusory disguise_ counts as setting up a disguise for the [Impersonate](/Actions.aspx?ID=46) use of [Deception](/Skills.aspx?ID=5); it ignores any circumstance penalties you might take for disguising yourself as a dissimilar creature, it gives you a +4 status bonus to Deception checks to prevent others from seeing through your disguise, and you add your level even if you're untrained. You can Dismiss this spell.

---
**Heightened (2nd)** The spell also disguises your voice and scent, and it gains the [auditory](/Traits.aspx?ID=16) and [olfactory](/Traits.aspx?ID=246) traits.

**Heightened (3rd)** You can appear as any creature of the same size, even a specific individual. You must have seen an individual to take on their appearance. The spell also disguises your voice and scent, and it gains the auditory trait.
_source.name: Illusory Disguise

<title level="1" right="Spell 1" pfs="Standard">
[Illusory Disguise](/Spells.aspx?ID=1568)
<actions string="Two Actions" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Concentrate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=32" />
<trait label="Illusion" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=92" />
<trait label="Manipulate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=104" />
<trait label="Visual" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=163" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Player Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=216) pg. 337</row>

**Traditions**
[Arcane](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1), [Occult](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=3)

**Deity**
[Norgorber](/Deities.aspx?ID=289)

<row gap="medium">

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** 30 feet

**Target** 1 willing creature
</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** 1 hour
</row>

</column>

---

You create an illusion that causes the target to appear as another creature of the same body shape, and with roughly similar height (within 6 inches) and weight (within 50 pounds). The disguise is typically good enough to hide their identity, but not to impersonate a specific individual. The spell changes their appearance and voice, but not mannerisms. You can change the appearance of its clothing and worn items, such as making its armor look like a dress. Held items are unaffected, and any worn item removed from the creature returns to its true appearance.

 Casting _illusory disguise_ counts as setting up a disguise for the [Impersonate](/Actions.aspx?ID=46) use of [Deception](/Skills.aspx?ID=5); it ignores any circumstance penalties the target might take for disguising itself as a dissimilar creature, gives a +4 status bonus to Deception checks to prevent others from seeing through the disguise, and lets the target add its level to such Deception checks even if untrained. You can Dismiss this spell. 

---
**Heightened (3rd)** The target can appear as any creature of the same size, even a specific individual. You must have seen an individual to replicate its appearance, and must have heard its voice to replicate its voice.

**Heightened (4th)** You can target up to 10 willing creatures. If you target multiple creatures, you can choose a different disguise for each target, but none can impersonate a specific individual. You can Dismiss each disguise individually or all collectively.

**Heightened (7th)** As 4th, but you can choose disguises that impersonate specific individuals. You must have seen an individual to replicate its appearance, and must have heard its voice to replicate its voice.
_source.name: Illusory Disguise

You create an illusory visual image of a stationary object. The entire image must fit within the spell's area. The object appears to animate naturally, but it doesn't make sounds or generate smells. For example, water would appear to pour down an illusory waterfall, but it would be silent.

 Any creature that touches the image or uses the [Seek](/Actions.aspx?ID=84) action to examine it can attempt to disbelieve your illusion.

---
**Heightened (2nd)** Your image makes appropriate sounds, generates normal smells, and feels right to the touch. The spell gains the [auditory](/Traits.aspx?ID=16) and [olfactory](/Traits.aspx?ID=246) traits. The duration increases to 1 hour.

**Heightened (5th)** As the 2nd-rank version, but the duration is unlimited.

---

You project psychic vibrations onto the target object, imprinting it with a short message or emotional theme of your design. This imprinted sensation is revealed to a creature who casts [_object reading_](/Spells.aspx?ID=553) on the target object, replacing any emotional events the item was present for. If the object is in the area of a [_retrocognition_](/Spells.aspx?ID=260) spell, the imprinted messages appear as major events in the timeline, but they don't interfere with any other visions.

 If the object is targeted with [_read aura_](/Spells.aspx?ID=246) of a higher spell level than _imprint message_, the caster learns that the object has been magically modified. When you Cast this Spell, any prior vibrations placed on an object by previous castings of _imprint message_ fade.

<title level="1" right="Cantrip 1" pfs="Standard">
[Infectious Enthusiasm](/Spells.aspx?ID=932)
<actions string="Two Actions" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Cantrip" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=22" />
<trait label="Emotion" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=60" />
<trait label="Enchantment" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=61" />
<trait label="Mental" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=106" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Secrets of Magic](/Sources.aspx?ID=96) pg. 112 <sup>1.1</sup></row>

**Traditions**
[Arcane](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1), [Occult](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=3)

<row gap="medium">

**Cast** [somatic](/Rules.aspx?ID=283), [verbal](/Rules.aspx?ID=284)

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">

</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** 1 round
</row>

</column>

---

With enchanted gusto, you encourage yourself to get things done and share your motivation with your allies. You gain a +1 status bonus to your choice of attack rolls, Will saves, or Charisma-based skill checks. During the spell's duration, an ally who observed you Casting this Spell and was within 30 feet when you did so can take a single action, which has the [concentrate](/Traits.aspx?ID=32) trait, to gain the same bonus you chose until the start of its next turn.

 Using this spell to influence someone in a social situation is typically considered a faux pas, negating the benefit on Charisma-based skills if the subject of the check observed you casting the spell.
_source.name: Infectious Enthusiasm

<actions string="Single Action to Three Actions" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Concentrate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=32" />
<trait label="Manipulate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=104" />

</traits>

[Divine](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=2)

**Range** 30 feet

**Target** 1 to 3 willing creatures
</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** 1 minute
</row>

</column>

---

You empower attacks with vital energy. The number of targets is equal to the number of actions you spent casting this spell. Each target's [unarmed](/Traits.aspx?ID=199) and weapon Strikes deal an extra 1d4 vitality damage. (This damage typically damages only undead, as explained on page 409). If you have the [holy](/Traits.aspx?ID=517) trait, you can add that trait to this spell and to the Strikes affected by the spell.

---
**Heightened (3rd)** The damage increases to 2d4 damage.

**Heightened (5th)** The damage increases to 3d4 damage.
_source.name: Infuse Vitality

<title level="1" right="Spell 1" pfs="Limited">
[Inkshot](/Spells.aspx?ID=1229)
<actions string="Two Actions" />
</title>

<spoilers>May contain spoilers from Kingmaker</spoilers>

<traits>
<trait label="Rare" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=137" />
<trait label="Conjuration" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=33" />
<trait label="Poison" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=126" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Kingmaker Companion Guide](/Sources.aspx?ID=151) pg. 46</row>

**Traditions**
[Occult](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=3), [Primal](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=4)

<row gap="medium">

**Cast** [verbal](/Rules.aspx?ID=284), [somatic](/Rules.aspx?ID=283)

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** 30 feet

</row>

<row gap="medium">

</row>

</column>

---

A spray of viscous, toxic ink jets from your fingertip to strike a target creature in the face. Make a spell attack roll against the target. On a hit, you deal 2d6 poison damage, plus you blast the target's eyes, making them [dazzled](/Conditions.aspx?ID=7) for 1 round as the stinging ink blurs and distorts the creature's vision. On a critical hit, double the poison damage, and the target becomes dazzled for 1 minute by the foul ink. 

The ink stain remains for 1 hour before fading, although vigorous cleansing (or magic such as a [_prestidigitation_](/Spells.aspx?ID=229) cantrip) can remove the ink before then.

---
**Heightened (+1)** Increase the base poison damage by 2d6.
_source.name: Inkshot

<actions string="Single Action" />
</title>

<spoilers>May contain spoilers from Blood Lords</spoilers>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />

</traits>

</row>

<row gap="medium">

</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** 10 minutes
</row>

</column>

---

You pull a large handful of guts from your midsection. Removing these guts doesn't harm you. You can use the guts as 50 feet of rope to help you [Climb](/Actions.aspx?ID=33), and they help attach you to a wall. You move half as quickly as usual while climbing with your guts (minimum 5 feet), but you can attempt a DC 5 flat check whenever you critically fail to prevent a fall. Other creatures can use your guts to climb like a squishy rope, but the guts don't help anyone but you attach to a wall. If you let go of your guts or your guts are damaged, the spell ends.

---
**Heightened (3rd)** You gain a +1 item bonus to [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=3) checks to Climb while using your guts.
_source.name: Inside Ropes

<title level="1" right="Spell 1" pfs="Standard">
[Instant Pottery](/Spells.aspx?ID=1336)
<actions string="" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Concentrate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=32" />
<trait label="Earth" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=55" />
<trait label="Manipulate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=104" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Rage of Elements](/Sources.aspx?ID=205) pg. 95</row>

**Traditions**
[Arcane](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1), [Primal](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=4)

<row gap="medium">

**Cast** 1 minute

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** 10 feet

</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** 1 hour
</row>

</column>

---

You pull earthen material out of the environment, then shape it into one or more earthenware objects that, in combination, can be up to light Bulk. Alternatively, you can cast this spell on objects previously created with this spell, extending their duration. No object can have intricate artistry or complex moving parts, can fulfill a cost or the like, or is made of anything more than clay or earth. Each object is obviously the product of temporary magic and thus can't be sold or passed off as a valuable item.

---
**Heightened (2nd)** You can create objects of up to 1 Bulk. They last 8 hours.

**Heightened (3rd)** You can create objects of up to 2 Bulk. They last 24 hours.
_source.name: Instant Pottery

<title level="1" right="Spell 1" pfs="Standard">
[Interposing Earth](/Spells.aspx?ID=1337)
<actions string="Reaction" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Earth" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=55" />
<trait label="Manipulate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=104" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Rage of Elements](/Sources.aspx?ID=205) pg. 95</row>

**Traditions**
[Arcane](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1), [Primal](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=4)

<row gap="medium">

 

**Trigger** You are the target of a Strike or would attempt a Reflex save against a damaging area effect

</row>

<row gap="medium">

</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** 3 rounds
</row>

</column>

---

You raise a flimsy barrier of earth to shield you from harm. This barrier is 1 inch thick, 5 feet long, 5 feet high, and must be placed on the border between two squares. This barrier appears between you and the source of the triggering effect and grants you [standard cover](/Rules.aspx?ID=459) against the triggering effect. If you would be damaged by the triggering effect despite this barrier, the barrier is destroyed, and the damage dealt to you is reduced by 2. The barrier remains in place for 3 rounds (or until destroyed). It has AC 5, 2 Hardness, and 5 Hit Points.

---
**Heightened (4th)** The damage reduced increases to 8, the barrier's hardness increases to 8, and the barrier's Hit Points increases to 20.
_source.name: Interposing Earth

<title level="1" right="Spell 1" pfs="Standard">
[Invisible Item](/Spells.aspx?ID=700)
<actions string="Two Actions" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Illusion" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=92" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Advanced Player's Guide](/Sources.aspx?ID=39) pg. 221 <sup>2.0</sup></row>

**Traditions**
[Arcane](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1), [Occult](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=3)

<row gap="medium">

**Cast** [material](/Rules.aspx?ID=282), [somatic](/Rules.aspx?ID=283)

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** touch

**Target** 1 object
</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** 1 hour
</row>

</column>

---

You make the object [invisible](/Conditions.aspx?ID=26). This makes it [undetected](/Conditions.aspx?ID=39) to all creatures, though the creatures can attempt to find the target, making it [hidden](/Conditions.aspx?ID=22) to them instead if they succeed. If the item is used as part of a hostile action, the spell ends after that hostile action is completed. Making a weapon invisible typically doesn't give any advantage to the attack, except that an invisible [thrown](/Traits.aspx?ID=195) weapon or piece of ammunition can be used for an attack without necessarily giving information about the attacker's hiding place unless the weapon returns to the attacker.

---
**Heightened (3rd)** The duration is until the next time you make your daily preparations.

**Heightened (7th)** The duration is unlimited.
_source.name: Invisible Item

<title level="1" right="Spell 1" pfs="Standard">
[Item Facade](/Spells.aspx?ID=1579)
<actions string="Two Actions" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Concentrate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=32" />
<trait label="Illusion" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=92" />
<trait label="Manipulate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=104" />
<trait label="Visual" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=163" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Player Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=216) pg. 340</row>

**Traditions**
[Arcane](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1), [Occult](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=3)

<row gap="medium">

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** touch

**Target** 1 object no more than 10 feet by 10 feet by 10 feet
</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** 1 hour
</row>

</column>

---

You make the target object look and feel as though it were in much better or worse physical condition. When you Cast this Spell, decide whether you want to make the object look decrepit or perfect. An item made to look decrepit appears broken and shoddy. An intact item made to look better appears as though it's brand new and highly polished or well maintained. A [broken](/Conditions.aspx?ID=2) item appears to be intact and functional. Destroyed items can't be affected by this spell. A creature that Interacts with the item can attempt to disbelieve the illusion.

---
**Heightened (2nd)** The duration is 24 hours.

**Heightened (3rd)** The duration is unlimited.
_source.name: Item Facade

**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 405 4.0 **Bloodline** [Hag](/Bloodlines.aspx?ID=8) **Cast** [verbal](/Rules.aspx?ID=284) **Range** 30 feet **Target** 1 creature **Saving Throw** Will **Duration** up to 1 minute --- You draw forth a hag's innate jealousy to deny a target its greatest attribute. The target is cursed with an adverse condition depending on its highest ability modifier: Strength (enfeebled); Dexterity (clumsy); Constitution (drained); or Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma (stupefied). On a tie, the creature decides which of the conditions associated with the tied ability modifiers to take. The target must attempt a Will save. **Success** The target is unaffected.
**Failure** The condition's value is 1.
**Critical Failure** The condition's value is 2. At the start of each of your turns, the target can attempt another Will save, ending the effect on a success.
_source.name: Jealous Hex

With touches to the targets’ foreheads, you bring them into mental communion. The targets can share thoughts and experiences, but not words. When one target attempts to [Recall Knowledge](/Actions.aspx?ID=26), the other can [Aid](/Actions.aspx?ID=75) the first target’s skill check, using any [Lore](/Skills.aspx?ID=8) skill (even if that Lore wouldn’t normally apply) without having made any preparations to Aid.

---
**Heightened (+1)** You can touch one additional target to include them in the spell’s effects. Multiple targets can attempt checks to Aid the target who is attempting to Recall Knowledge.

**Target** your [companion](AnimalCompanions.aspx)
</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** 10 minutes
</row>

---

You transform your companion into its juvenile form, such as a cub, foal, kitten, puppy, or piglet, making the target appear harmless. It becomes Tiny (if it was larger), and its reach is reduced to 0 feet. All of its Speeds are halved (to a minimum Speed of 5 feet), and it gains weakness 5 to physical damage. In all other ways, its abilities and statistics are unchanged.

 If your companion uses a [hostile action](/Rules.aspx?ID=300), _juvenile companion_ ends. This spell has no effect on a companion that doesn't have a juvenile form.

---
**Heightened (2nd)** The duration increases to 1 hour.
_source.name: Juvenile Companion

**Source** [Dark Archive](/Sources.aspx?ID=129) pg. 105 **Traditions** [Arcane](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1), [Occult](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=3) **Cast** [verbal](/Rules.aspx?ID=284) **Range** varies **Target** 1 or more creatures **Saving Throw** Fortitude --- Gathering kinetic energy, you either focus it in a straight line or disperse it as an encircling ripple. Any creature targeted by this spell must succeed at a Fortitude saving throw or be [pushed](/Rules.aspx?ID=451) 10 feet away from you (or 20 feet on a critical failure). The spell's area or range and how many creatures it affects is based on how many actions you spend when Casting the Spell.
  • The spell targets one creature within 15 feet.
  • The spell targets one creature within 30 feet. The distance the target is pushed if it fails is doubled, and on a critical failure, the target is also knocked prone and takes 1d6 bludgeoning damage.
  • The spell targets all creatures in a 5-foot emanation.
_source.name: Kinetic Ram

<title level="1" right="Spell 1" pfs="">
[Know Location](/Spells.aspx?ID=1429)
<actions string="" />
</title>

<spoilers>May contain spoilers from Sky King's Tomb</spoilers>

<traits>
<trait label="Rare" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=137" />
<trait label="Detection" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=43" />
<trait label="Divination" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=47" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Pathfinder #194: Cult of the Cave Worm](/Sources.aspx?ID=209) pg. 79</row>

**Traditions**
[Divine](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=2), [Occult](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=3), [Primal](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=4)

<row gap="medium">

**Cast** 1 minute ([somatic](/Rules.aspx?ID=283),  [verbal](/Rules.aspx?ID=284))

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** 1 mile

</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** until the next time you make your daily preparations
</row>

</column>

---

You create an invisible anchor at a location within range (even if it's outside your line of sight or line of effect), as long as you can identify the location by its appearance (or other identifying features). You innately know the direction towards that location, including relative depth, but not the distance.

 Incorrect knowledge of the location's appearance usually causes the spell to fail, but it could instead lead to an unwanted location or some other unusual mishap determined by the GM. This spell doesn't help you find a suitable route to the location nor assist you in overcoming obstacles on the way there.

---
**Heightened (3rd)** The range is 10 miles.

**Heightened (5th)** The range is 100 miles.

**Heightened (7th)** The range is planetary and you can create an anchor at a location you've viewed with [_scrying_](/Spells.aspx?ID=268) or similar effects.
_source.name: Know Location

---

Your hands become infused with positive energy, healing a living creature or damaging an undead creature with a touch. If you use _lay on hands_ on a willing living target, you restore 6 Hit Points; if the target is one of your allies, they also gain a +2 status bonus to AC for 1 round. Against an undead target, you deal 1d6 damage and it must attempt a basic Fortitude save; if it fails, it also takes a –2 status penalty to AC for 1 round.

---
**Heightened (+1)** The amount of healing increases by 6, and the damage to an undead target increases by 1d6.
_source.name: Lay on Hands

<title level="1" right="Focus 1" pfs="Standard">
[Life Link](/Spells.aspx?ID=758)
<actions string="Single Action" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Cursebound" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=320" />
<trait label="Focus" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=511" />
<trait label="Healing" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=89" />
<trait label="Necromancy" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=117" />
<trait label="Oracle" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=319" />
<trait label="Positive" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=128" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Advanced Player's Guide](/Sources.aspx?ID=39) pg. 232 <sup>2.0</sup></row>

**Mystery**
[Life](/Mysteries.aspx?ID=6)

<row gap="medium">

**Cast** [somatic](/Rules.aspx?ID=283)

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** 30 feet

**Target** 1 creature other than you
</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** 1 minute
</row>

</column>

---

You forge a connection of life energy between you and your target, distributing harm between both of you. When you first Cast the Spell, the target recovers 1d4 Hit Points. The first time each round that the target takes damage, reduce the damage it takes by 3 (to a minimum of 0 damage). You lose 3 Hit Points each time, or the total damage dealt, if less than 3; this damage ignores any immunities or resistances you have and can't otherwise be mitigated in any way.

The spell ends immediately if you fall [unconscious](/Conditions.aspx?ID=38). You can Dismiss the spell.

---
**Heightened (3rd)** You can target 2 creatures other than you. Increase the initial healing to 3d4 and the maximum damage reduced and Hit Points lost to 5.

**Heightened (6th)** You can target 3 creatures other than you. Increase the initial healing to 6d4 and the maximum damage reduced and Hit Points lost to 10.

**Heightened (9th)** You can target 4 creatures other than you. Increase the initial healing to 9d4 and the maximum damage reduced and Hit Points lost to 15.
_source.name: Life Link

May contain spoilers from Abomination Vaults **Source** [Pathfinder #165: Eyes of Empty Death](/Sources.aspx?ID=81) pg. 65 **Domain** [Abomination](/Domains.aspx?ID=59) **Cast** [somatic](/Rules.aspx?ID=283), [verbal](/Rules.aspx?ID=284) **Range** 5-foot emanation **Target** creatures in the area **Saving Throw** Will **Duration** varies --- With a wave of the hand, you cause the targets to see the world around them as if a gauzy film had been lifted away to expose the truth that lies below their perceived reality. Natural features they can see grow twisted and horrendous, structures appear distorted and ruined, and objects seem warped and alien. This alternate vision fades quickly, but the glimpse beyond the natural world lingers for the spell's duration. Aberrations or worshippers of Outer Gods or Great Old Ones are bolstered by this vision of warped reality and gain a +1 status bonus to Will saving throws and attack rolls for 1 minute, while all other creatures must attempt a Will saving throw. **Critical Success** The creature is unaffected and temporarily immune for 1 hour.
**Success** The creature is [sickened 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=34).
**Failure** The creature is [stupefied 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=37) for 1 minute and [frightened 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=19).
**Critical Failure** The creature is stupefied 1 for 1 minute and frightened 2. It can't reduce the value of its frightened condition below 1 as long as it remains stupefied by this spell. --- **Heightened (+2)** You increase the area by 5 feet and the duration of the stupefied condition by 1 minute.
_source.name: Lift Nature's Caul

</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Cantrip" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=22" />
<trait label="Concentrate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=32" />
<trait label="Light" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=100" />

</traits>

**Traditions**
[Arcane](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1), [Divine](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=2), [Occult](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=3), [Primal](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=4)

<row gap="medium">

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** 120 feet

</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** until your next daily preparations
</row>

</column>

---

You create an orb of light that sheds [bright light](/Rules.aspx?ID=407) in a 20-foot radius (and [dim light](/Rules.aspx?ID=408) for the next 20 feet) in a color you choose. If you create the light in the same space as a willing creature, you can attach the light to the creature, causing it to float near that creature as it moves. You can Sustain the spell to move the light up to 60 feet; you can attach or detach it from a creature as part of this movement.

 You can Dismiss the spell. If you Cast the Spell while you already have four _light_ spells active, you must choose one of the existing spells to end.

---
**Heightened (4th)** The orb sheds light in a 60-foot radius (and dim light for the next 60 feet).
_source.name: Light

<title level="1" right="Spell 1" pfs="Standard">
[Lock](/Spells.aspx?ID=1589)
<actions string="Two Actions" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Concentrate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=32" />
<trait label="Manipulate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=104" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Player Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=216) pg. 341</row>

**Traditions**
[Arcane](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1), [Divine](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=2), [Occult](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=3)

<row gap="medium">

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** touch

**Target** 1 lock, or a door or container with a latch
</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** until your next daily preparations
</row>

</column>

---

The target's latch mechanism clinks shut, held fast by unseen magical wards. When you magically lock a target, you set an [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=3) and [Thievery](/Skills.aspx?ID=17) DC to open it equal to your spell DC or the base lock DC with a +4 status bonus, whichever is higher. Any key or combination that once opened a lock affected by this spell does not do so for the duration of the spell, though the key or combination does grant a +4 circumstance bonus to checks to open the door.

 If the target is opened, the spell ends. Assuming the target is not barred or locked in some additional way, you can unlock and open it with an Interact action during which you touch the target. This does not end the spell. You can Dismiss this spell at any time and from any distance.

---
**Heightened (2nd)** The duration is unlimited, but you must expend 6 gp worth of precious metals as an additional cost.
_source.name: Lock

</column>

---

You alter the appearance of an item's magic aura. You can choose to have the target's aura appear as that of a common magic item of twice _magic aura_'s level or lower, or to have it register as being under the effects of a spell of your choice of _magic aura_'s level or lower. If the target is [magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), you can instead choose to have it appear as entirely non-magical.

 A caster using [_detect magic_](/Spells.aspx?ID=66) or [_read aura_](/Spells.aspx?ID=246) of an equal or higher spell level can attempt to disbelieve the illusion from _magic aura_. _Magic aura_ doesn't mask the aura of spells that are 9th level or higher or of items that are 19th level or higher.

---
**Heightened (3rd)** You can target a creature instead of an object. When you do, you can either conceal the auras of all magic items it has or have that creature's aura appear as if it were under the effect of a spell you know.
_source.name: Magic Aura

You pour positive energy into ordinary stones, granting them temporary magical properties. You can target 1 non-magical stone or sling bullet for every action you use Casting this Spell. The stones must be unattended or carried by you or a willing ally. The stones become _+1 [striking](/Equipment.aspx?ID=280) [disrupting](/Equipment.aspx?ID=294) [sling bullets](/Weapons.aspx?ID=82)_. Each stone can be used only once, after which it crumbles to dust.

<traits>

<trait label="Illusion" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=92" />
<trait label="Linguistic" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=101" />

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Player Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=216) pg. 343</row>

**Target** 1 creature
</row>

<row gap="medium">

</row>

</column>

---

You mouth words quietly, but instead of coming out of your mouth, they're transferred directly to the ears of the target. While others can't hear your words any better than if you normally mouthed them, the target can hear your words as if they were standing next to you. The target can give a brief response as a reaction, or as a free action on their next turn if they wish, but they must be able to see you and be within range to do so. If they respond, their response is delivered directly to your ear, just like the original message.

---
**Heightened (3rd)** The spell's range increases to 500 feet.
_source.name: Message

<title level="1" right="Spell 1" pfs="Standard">
[Message Rune](/Spells.aspx?ID=581)
<actions string="" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Divination" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=47" />
<trait label="Linguistic" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=101" />
<trait label="Mental" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=106" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Gods & Magic](/Sources.aspx?ID=17) pg. 108 <sup>2.0</sup></row>

**Traditions**
[Arcane](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1), [Occult](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=3)

**Deities**
[Lissala](/Deities.aspx?ID=156), [Mephistopheles](/Deities.aspx?ID=69), [Nyarlathotep (The Crawling Chaos)](/Deities.aspx?ID=164), [Pillars of Knowledge](/Deities.aspx?ID=209), [Thoth](/Deities.aspx?ID=61), [Ydajisk](/Deities.aspx?ID=148)

<row gap="medium">

**Cast** 5 minutes ([material](/Rules.aspx?ID=282), [somatic](/Rules.aspx?ID=283), [verbal](/Rules.aspx?ID=284))

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** touch

**Target** 1 flat unattended surface
</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** 1 day
</row>

</column>

---

You record a message up to 5 minutes long and inscribe a special rune on any flat unattended surface within reach. The nature of the rune’s appearance is up to you, but it is visible to everyone and it must be no smaller than 2 inches in diameter. You also specify a [trigger](/Rules.aspx?ID=301) that creatures must meet to activate the rune. For the duration of the spell, creatures who meet the criteria of the trigger can touch the rune to hear the recorded message in their head as though you were speaking to them telepathically. You know when someone is listening to the message, but you do not know who is listening to it. You can Dismiss the spell.
_source.name: Message Rune

<title level="1" right="Cantrip 1" pfs="Standard">
[Musical Accompaniment](/Spells.aspx?ID=1289)
<actions string="Two Actions" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Auditory" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=16" />
<trait label="Cantrip" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=22" />
<trait label="Illusion" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=92" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Firebrands](/Sources.aspx?ID=196) pg. 90</row>

**Traditions**
[Arcane](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1), [Occult](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=3)

<row gap="medium">

</row>

<row gap="medium">

</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** 1 minute
</row>

</column>

---

You're surrounded by orchestral music that shifts and changes to match your behavior. This music provides a +1 status bonus to Performance checks. At the GM's discretion, it provides this bonus to [Deception](/Skills.aspx?ID=5), [Diplomacy](/Skills.aspx?ID=6), and [Intimidation](/Skills.aspx?ID=7) checks as the music changes to support you in social situations, though some creatures are unaffected by such obvious attempts to use music to illicit specific emotions. This music moves with you and has a maximum volume equal to four humans shouting. You take a –4 penalty to [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=15) checks while the music is playing. You can't control the exact music this spell creates. The music doesn't create intelligible words or singing. You can Dismiss this spell.

---
**Heightened (2nd)** The duration increases to 10 minutes.

**Heightened (3rd)** The duration increases to 1 hour.

**Heightened (5th)** The duration increases to 24 hours.

<title level="1" right="Spell 1" pfs="Standard">
[Mystic Armor](/Spells.aspx?ID=1611)
<actions string="Two Actions" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Concentrate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=32" />
<trait label="Manipulate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=104" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Player Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=216) pg. 346</row>

**Traditions**
[Arcane](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1), [Divine](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=2), [Occult](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=3), [Primal](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=4)

**Lesson**
[Lesson of Protection](/Lessons.aspx?ID=19)

<row gap="medium">

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">

</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** until your next daily preparations
</row>

</column>

---

You ward yourself with shimmering magical energy, gaining a +1 item bonus to AC and a maximum Dexterity modifier of +5. While wearing _mystic armor_, you use your unarmored proficiency to calculate your AC.

---
**Heightened (4th)** You gain a +1 item bonus to saving throws.

**Heightened (6th)** The item bonus to AC increases to +2, and you gain a +1 item bonus to saving throws.

**Heightened (8th)** The item bonus to AC increases to +2, and you gain a +2 item bonus to saving throws.

**Heightened (10th)** The item bonus to AC increases to +3, and you gain a +3 item bonus to saving throws.
_source.name: Mystic Armor

<title level="1" right="Spell 1" pfs="Standard">
[Necromancer's Generosity](/Spells.aspx?ID=955)
<actions string="Two Actions" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Necromancy" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=117" />
<trait label="Negative" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=118" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Secrets of Magic](/Sources.aspx?ID=96) pg. 117 <sup>1.1</sup></row>

**Traditions**
[Arcane](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1), [Divine](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=2)

<row gap="medium">

**Cast** [somatic](/Rules.aspx?ID=283), [verbal](/Rules.aspx?ID=284)

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** 30 feet

**Target** 1 [undead](/Traits.aspx?ID=160) [minion](/Traits.aspx?ID=109) you control
</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** 1 minute
</row>

</column>

---

You channel negative energy through your magical connection to your undead minion to strengthen the creature. The target regains 1d8+4 Hit Points when you Cast the Spell, and it gains a +2 status bonus to saves against [positive](/Traits.aspx?ID=128) effects for the duration.

---
**Heightened (+1)** The amount of healing increases by 1d8+4.
_source.name: Necromancer's Generosity

_source.markdown:
**Source** [Rage of Elements](/Sources.aspx?ID=205) pg. 144 _[**PFS Note**](/pathfinder-society) Any spells which require metal to function require the PC to be holding at least one chunk of that metal or an item made of that metal._ **Traditions** [Arcane](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1), [Divine](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=2), [Occult](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=3), [Primal](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=4) **Range** 60 feet **Target** 1 creature **Defense** AC --- You shape three needles out of a piece of metal in your possession and send them flying in a tight group toward one target. Make a spell attack roll against your target's AC. The needles deal 3d4 piercing damage and might cause bleeding. The needles impart any special properties of the metal that forms them; for instance, [cold iron](/Equipment.aspx?ID=272) needles deal additional damage to creatures with weakness to cold iron. All the needles are made of the same metal, and the metal returns to you after the attack. **Critical Success** The target takes double damage and 1 [persistent bleed damage](/Conditions.aspx?ID=29).
**Success** The target takes full damage. --- **Heightened (+1)** You send one additional needle, increasing the regular damage by 1d4 and increasing the persistent bleed damage on a critical hit by 1.
_source.name: Needle Darts

<title level="1" right="Focus 1" pfs="Standard">
[Needle of Vengeance](/Spells.aspx?ID=1881)
<actions string="Single Action" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Focus" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=511" />
<trait label="Hex" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=324" />
<trait label="Manipulate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=104" />
<trait label="Mental" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=106" />
<trait label="Witch" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=323" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Player Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=216) pg. 385</row>

**Lesson**
[Lesson of Vengeance](/Lessons.aspx?ID=20)

<row gap="medium">

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** 30 feet

**Target** 1 enemy
</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Defense**
[basic](/Rules.aspx?ID=329) Will

**Duration** sustained up to 1 minute
</row>

</column>

---

A long, jagged needle jabs into the target foe's psyche whenever it tries to attack a creature your patron holds in special regard. Name yourself or one of your allies. The target takes 2 mental damage any time it uses a [hostile action](/Rules.aspx?ID=300) against the named creature, with a basic Will save.

---
**Heightened (+1)** Increase the damage by 2.
_source.name: Needle of Vengeance

<title level="1" right="Spell 1" pfs="Standard">
[Negate Aroma](/Spells.aspx?ID=206)
<actions string="Two Actions" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Abjuration" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=2" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 354 <sup>4.0</sup></row>

**Traditions**
[Arcane](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1), [Primal](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=4)

**Deity**
[Skode](/Deities.aspx?ID=239)

<row gap="medium">

**Cast** [somatic](/Rules.aspx?ID=283), [verbal](/Rules.aspx?ID=284)

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** touch

**Target** 1 willing creature
</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** 1 hour
</row>

</column>

---

The target loses its odor, preventing creatures from passively noticing its presence via smell alone, even if the creatures have precise or imprecise scent. A creature attempting a Perception check to Seek with scent and other senses might notice the lack of natural scent. If the target has any abilities that result from its smell, such as an overpowering scent, those abilities are also negated.

---
**Heightened (5th)** The range increases to 30 feet, and you can target up to 10 creatures.
_source.name: Negate Aroma

<title level="1" right="Spell 1" pfs="Limited">
[Nettleskin](/Spells.aspx?ID=1093)
<actions string="Two Actions" />
</title>

<spoilers>May contain spoilers from Threshold of Knowledge</spoilers>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Plant" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=125" />
<trait label="Transmutation" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=157" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Threshold of Knowledge](/Sources.aspx?ID=109) pg. 10</row>

**Tradition**
[Primal](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=4)

<row gap="medium">

**Cast** [somatic](/Rules.aspx?ID=283), [verbal](/Rules.aspx?ID=284)

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">

</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** 1 minute
</row>

</column>

---

Thorns sprout from your body; they pass through and don't damage any clothing or armor you wear. Adjacent creatures that hit you with a melee or [unarmed](/Traits.aspx?ID=199) attack take 1d4 piercing damage as the nettles jab them and break off. Each time a creature takes damage in this way, _nettleskin's_ duration decreases by 1 round.

---
**Heightened (+1)** The damage increases by 1d4.
_source.name: Nettleskin

<title level="1" right="Spell 1" pfs="Standard">
[Noxious Vapors](/Spells.aspx?ID=704)
<actions string="Two Actions" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Evocation" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=65" />
<trait label="Poison" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=126" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Advanced Player's Guide](/Sources.aspx?ID=39) pg. 222 <sup>2.0</sup></row>

**Traditions**
[Arcane](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1), [Primal](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=4)

<row gap="medium">

**Cast** [somatic](/Rules.aspx?ID=283), [verbal](/Rules.aspx?ID=284)

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Area** 10-foot emanation

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Saving Throw** 
[basic](/Rules.aspx?ID=329) Fortitude

**Duration** 1 round
</row>

</column>

---

You emit a cloud of toxic smoke that temporarily obscures you from sight. Each creature except you in the area when you Cast the Spell takes 1d6 poison damage (basic Fortitude save). A creature that critically fails the saving throw also becomes [sickened 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=34). All creatures in the area become [concealed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=4), and all creatures outside the smoke become concealed to creatures within it. This smoke can be dispersed by a strong wind.

---
**Heightened (+1)** The damage increases by 1d6.
_source.name: Noxious Vapors

<title level="1" right="Cantrip 1" pfs="Standard">
[Nudge Fate](/Spells.aspx?ID=1890)
<actions string="Single Action" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Cantrip" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=22" />
<trait label="Concentrate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=32" />
<trait label="Hex" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=324" />
<trait label="Witch" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=323" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Player Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=216) pg. 387</row>

**Patron Theme**
[Spinner of Threads](/Patrons.aspx?ID=16)

<row gap="medium">

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** 30 feet

**Target** 1 creature
</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Defense**
Will

**Duration** 1 minute
</row>

</column>

---

The barest spin of your patron's spool is enough to alter fate. When the target fails an attack roll, skill check, or saving throw and a +1 status bonus would turn a critical failure into a failure, or failure into a success, you grant the target a +1 status bonus to the check retroactively, changing the outcome appropriately. The spell then ends.

 If you cast _nudge fate_ while a previous casting of this hex is still in effect, the previous effect ends.
_source.name: Nudge Fate

<title level="1" right="Spell 1" pfs="Standard">
[Nudge the Odds](/Spells.aspx?ID=957)
<actions string="Two Actions" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Divination" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=47" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Secrets of Magic](/Sources.aspx?ID=96) pg. 118 <sup>1.1</sup></row>

**Traditions**
[Arcane](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1), [Divine](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=2), [Occult](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=3)

<row gap="medium">

**Cast** [somatic](/Rules.aspx?ID=283), [verbal](/Rules.aspx?ID=284)

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">

</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** 1 hour
</row>

</column>

---

You bestow yourself supernaturally good luck at cards, dice, and other games of chance. You gain a +1 status bonus to [Games Lore](/Skills.aspx?ID=8) checks to gamble, and if you roll a critical failure on such a check, you get a failure instead; however, the spell is too short-lived to use for [Earn Income](/Actions.aspx?ID=23) checks from gambling.

 When you're under the effect of nudge the odds, one facial feature, such as a lock of hair or the iris of an eye, transforms to a distinctive golden color; the GM chooses which feature when you cast the spell. This change resists all magical efforts to conceal it, though it can be hidden or covered by mundane means. A creature noticing the feature can identify the spell using [Recall Knowledge](/Actions.aspx?ID=26). Because it prevents losing big, gamblers consider _nudge the odds_ a repugnant form of cheating. If you're caught using the spell, you are likely to suffer serious consequences, depending on the nature of the gamblers you cheated.

---
**Heightened (5th)** The status bonus increases to +2, and the duration increases to last until the next time you make your daily preparations. If you continue spending your spell slot to keep the duration active, this allows you to apply the effect to a downtime check to Earn Income.
_source.name: Nudge the Odds

<title level="1" right="Focus 1" pfs="Standard">
[Nymph's Token](/Spells.aspx?ID=785)
<actions string="Two Actions" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Enchantment" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=61" />
<trait label="Focus" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=511" />
<trait label="Sorcerer" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=148" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Advanced Player's Guide](/Sources.aspx?ID=39) pg. 236 <sup>2.0</sup></row>

**Bloodline**
[Nymph](/Bloodlines.aspx?ID=12)

<row gap="medium">

**Cast** [somatic](/Rules.aspx?ID=283), [verbal](/Rules.aspx?ID=284)

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">

</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** 1 minute
</row>

</column>

---

You grant an ally a token of favor. You create a token, such as a lock of your hair or a flower, that persists for the spell's duration; as part of Casting the Spell, you can Interact to pass the token to an ally within your reach. As long as the ally has the token on their person, they gain a +1 status bonus to [Performance](/Skills.aspx?ID=12) checks and Will saves. You can Dismiss the spell as a free action.

---
**Heightened (4th)** As long as the ally has the token on their person, you can cast spells that have a range of touch on them at a range of 30 feet.
_source.name: Nymph's Token
_source.search_markdown:

<title level="1" right="Focus 1" pfs="Standard">
[Oathkeeper's Insignia](/Spells.aspx?ID=604)
<actions string="Free Action" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Conjuration" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=33" />
<trait label="Focus" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=511" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Gods & Magic](/Sources.aspx?ID=17) pg. 114 <sup>2.0</sup></row>

**Domain**
[Duty](/Domains.aspx?ID=45)

<row gap="medium">

**Cast** [verbal](/Rules.aspx?ID=284)

 

**Trigger** You make a promise or deal.

</row>

<row gap="medium">

</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** 1 hour
</row>

</column>

---

A magical indicator assures a creature that you’ve upheld your end of a bargain. When you Cast the Spell, you create a bracelet, flower, or other such trinket. If, while the spell persists, you complete the terms of the promise or deal you made, the trinket fades away with a pleasant chime; if you violate the terms instead, the trinket breaks with a dissonant crash.

---
**Heightened (3rd)** The duration becomes 1 day.

**Heightened (5th)** The duration becomes 1 week.

**Heightened (7th)** The duration becomes 1 month.

**Heightened (9th)** The duration becomes 1 year.
_source.name: Oathkeeper's Insignia

<title level="1" right="Focus 1" pfs="Standard">
[Object Memory](/Spells.aspx?ID=624)
<actions string="Two Actions" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Divination" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=47" />
<trait label="Focus" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=511" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Gods & Magic](/Sources.aspx?ID=17) pg. 118 <sup>2.0</sup></row>

**Domain**
[Vigil](/Domains.aspx?ID=55)

<row gap="medium">

**Cast** [somatic](/Rules.aspx?ID=283), [verbal](/Rules.aspx?ID=284)

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Target** 1 weapon or tool
</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** 1 minute
</row>

</column>

---

By touching an object, you draw forth the experience of those who created and used it. If you touch a weapon, your proficiency rank with that weapon temporarily increases to trained (if it is not already higher). If you touch a tool, your proficiency rank with the next skill check you attempt with that tool (such as a [Crafting](/Skills.aspx?ID=4) check with a blacksmith’s hammer) within the spell’s duration temporarily increases to trained (if it is not already higher). This spell has no benefit for activities that take longer than a minute to complete.

---
**Heightened (6th)** Your proficiency rank increases to expert instead of trained.
_source.name: Object Memory

<title level="1" right="Spell 1" pfs="Standard">
[Object Reading](/Spells.aspx?ID=705)
<actions string="Two Actions" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Divination" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=47" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Advanced Player's Guide](/Sources.aspx?ID=39) pg. 222 <sup>2.0</sup>, [Pathfinder #147: Tomorrow Must Burn](/Sources.aspx?ID=8) pg. 74</row>

**Tradition**
[Occult](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=3)

**Deities**
[Cosmic Caravan](/Deities.aspx?ID=219), [Cosmic Caravan](/Deities.aspx?ID=219)

<row gap="medium">

**Cast** [somatic](/Rules.aspx?ID=283), [verbal](/Rules.aspx?ID=284)

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** touch

**Target** 1 object
</row>

<row gap="medium">

</row>

</column>

---

You place a hand on an object to learn a piece of information about an emotional event that occurred involving the object within the past week, determined by the GM. If you cast _object reading_ on the same item multiple times, you can either concentrate on a single event to gain additional pieces of information about that event, or gain a piece of information about another emotional event in the applicable time frame.

---
**Heightened (2nd)** You can learn about an event that occurred within the last month.

**Heightened (4th)** You can learn about an event that occurred within the last year.

**Heightened (6th)** You can learn about an event that occurred within the last decade.

**Heightened (8th)** You can learn about an event that occurred within the last century.

**Heightened (9th)** You can learn about an event that occurred within the entirety of the object’s history.
_source.name: Object Reading

**Source** [Firebrands](/Sources.aspx?ID=196) pg. 90 **Traditions** [Arcane](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1), [Occult](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=3) **Cast** [somatic](/Rules.aspx?ID=283) **Trigger** A creature damages you. **Range** 60 feet **Target** the triggering creature **Saving Throw** Will --- You make a grand spectacle out of getting hit. Enhanced by magic, this spectacle features sprays of blood, anguished screams, or other theatrics that appear to result from your foe's attack. The triggering creature must attempt a Will saving throw. **Critical Success** The creature is unaffected.
**Success** The creature is thrown off by your display. The creature becomes [dazzled](/Conditions.aspx?ID=7) until the start of your turn.
**Failure** The creature fully believes your performance, leaving itself open. The creature becomes dazzled and [flat-footed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=16) until the start of your turn.
**Critical Failure** The creature is enraptured by the display. The creature uses its remaining actions to watch you in awe. It then remains dazzled and flat-footed until the start of your turn.
_source.name: Overselling Flourish

**Source** [Dark Archive](/Sources.aspx?ID=129) pg. 159 **Patron Theme** [Pacts](/Patrons.aspx?ID=11) **Cast** [verbal](/Rules.aspx?ID=284) **Range** 30 feet **Target** 1 creature **Saving Throw** Will **Duration** sustained up to 1 minute --- You offer to broker a pact of peace. If the target accepts and doesn't take [hostile actions](/Rules.aspx?ID=300) against you and your allies, you take a –1 status penalty to [Deception](/Skills.aspx?ID=5) checks to [Lie](/Actions.aspx?ID=47) to them. If they refuse and take a hostile action against you or an ally, they must attempt a Will save. If they accepted the offer and then take a hostile action against you or an ally, they must attempt a Will save and treat the result as one category worse. Regardless of the outcome, the target is then temporarily immune for 1 minute. **Success** The target is unaffected.
**Failure** The target takes a –1 status penalty to attack and damage rolls against you and your allies.
**Critical Failure** The target takes a –2 status penalty to attack and damage rolls against you and your allies.
_source.name: Pact Broker

**Source** [Gods & Magic](/Sources.aspx?ID=17) pg. 114 2.0 **Domain** [Dust](/Domains.aspx?ID=44) **Cast** [somatic](/Rules.aspx?ID=283), [verbal](/Rules.aspx?ID=284) **Range** 60 feet **Target** 1 creature **Saving Throw** Fortitude --- Dry winds dehydrate a creature. The target must attempt a Fortitude save; if used on a creature with the water trait or a creature made primarily of liquid (such as many oozes), the creature uses the outcome for one degree of success worse than the result. Creatures whose bodies contain no significant moisture (such as earth elementals) are immune to _parch_.
**Critical Success** The target is unaffected.
**Success** The target takes a –1 status penalty to its checks and DCs for 1 round.
**Failure** The target takes a –1 status penalty to its checks and DCs for 1 minute.
**Critical Failure** The target takes a –2 status penalty to its checks and DCs for 1 minute and is [dazzled](/Conditions.aspx?ID=7) as long as it has this penalty. If a creature affected by _parch_ drinks a liquid, such as a swig of water or a potion, the spell ends. Affected creatures that have the [water](/Traits.aspx?ID=165) trait or are made primarily of liquid, as well as affected creatures that can’t drink, can end the effect as a two-action activity, which has the [concentrate](/Traits.aspx?ID=32) trait. --- **Heightened (4th)** You can target up to 4 creatures.
_source.name: Parch

<title level="1" right="Spell 1" pfs="Limited">

<actions string="Two Actions" />
</title>

<spoilers>May contain spoilers from Extinction Curse</spoilers>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Evocation" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=65" />
<trait label="Water" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=165" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Pathfinder #151: The Show Must Go On](/Sources.aspx?ID=21) pg. 78</row>

**Traditions**
[Arcane](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1), [Primal](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=4)

<row gap="medium">

**Cast** [somatic](/Rules.aspx?ID=283), [verbal](/Rules.aspx?ID=284)

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** 60 feet

**Target** 1 creature
</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Saving Throw** 
Reflex

**Duration** 1 minute
</row>

</column>

---

You conjure a 5-foot-wide rain cloud that follows the target wherever it goes. It stays roughly an arm’s length overhead, unless it must drift lower to fit under a ceiling. The cloud rains constantly on the target, keeping it wet and dampening the ground in the wake of any movement. The rain extinguishes non-magical flames. The target gains fire resistance 2. Creatures with weakness to water take damage equal to their weakness at the end of each of their turns. Creatures can attempt a Reflex save to avoid the cloud.

---
**Heightened (+1)** The amount of fire resistance increases by 2.
_source.name: Personal Rain Cloud

**Source** [Player Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=216) pg. 348 **Traditions** [Arcane](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1), [Primal](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=4) **Duration** 10 minutes --- You transform into the battle form of a Tiny animal, such as a cat, insect, lizard, or rat. You can decide the specific type of animal (such as a rat or praying mantis), but this has no effect on your Size or statistics. While in this form, you gain the [animal](/Traits.aspx?ID=9) trait, and you can't make Strikes. You can Dismiss the spell. You gain the following statistics and abilities:
  • AC = 15 + your level. Ignore your armor's check penalty and Speed reduction.
  • Speed 20 feet.
  • Weakness 5 to physical damage. (If you take physical damage in this form, you take 5 additional damage.)
  • [Low-light vision](/Rules.aspx?ID=416) and [imprecise](/Rules.aspx?ID=412) [scent](/Rules.aspx?ID=417) 30 feet.
  • [Acrobatics](/Skills.aspx?ID=1) and [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=15) modifiers of +10, unless your own is higher; [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=3) modifier –4.
--- **Heightened (4th)** You can turn into a flying creature, such as a bird, which grants you a fly Speed of 20 feet.
_source.name: Pest Form
